description: Change of use, refurbishment and extension of the properties to provide a mixed use development comprising a five screen cinema including an ancillary restaurant/cafe (incorporating a roof terrace), 3 self contained flats on the upper floors and associated facilities.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design & Access Statement, Planning Statement and Transport Statement received 19th August 2016; Flood Risk Assessment incorporating Surface Water and Foul Water Drainage Strategy & Sustainability Statement incorporating Energy Statement received 2nd November 2016; Noise Impact Assessment received 7th November 2016; Daylight & Sunlight Report received 18th November 2016; drawing no's 155-A 2-GA 101B, 103C, 104C & 106B received 2nd November 2016; drawing no's 155-A 2-GA 102C, 105D, 201D, 202E, 301H & 302E received 16th November 2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 08.00 to 18.00 on Mondays to Friday and 09.00 to 13.00 on Saturdays, and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the
construction of the external surfaces of the buildings hereby permitted, colour
samples of newly painted brickwork and details showing the retention of window
surrounds for blocked windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the
local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the
approved details.
Condition : 5 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority in writing.

Condition : 6 - No commercial deliveries or refuse collection shall be taken at or despatched from the site outside the hours of 08.00 to 18.00 Mondays to Saturdays, nor at any time on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The commercial uses hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times:
Cinema screens: Sunday to Thursdays 08.00 - 00.00; Friday to Saturday 08.00 ? 01.00.
Caf?/restaurant: Sunday to Thursday 08.00 - 23.30; Friday to Saturday 08.00 - 00.00.
Terrace: All week 08.00 - 22.30 (Fully vacated at 22.30).

Condition : 8 - Dining or drinking shall not take place anywhere on the site (commercial premises only) except within the building, or on the terrace within the approved hours of operation of this facility. No dining is to take place on the pavement.
Condition : 9 - The roof area to the north/adjoining unit 1 as shown on drawing no. 155-A 2-GA 102C hereby permitted shall not be used as a terrace, roof garden or similar amenity area.

Condition : 10 - The window panes of the eastern window on the north elevation of unit 1 (shown as living room window without Juliet balcony on drawing no?s 155-A 2-GA 102C & 301H hereby permitted) shall be obscurely glazed up to a height of 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed and non-opening below this height, and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise in accordance with these requirements.

Condition : 11 - Details of the fixed external privacy louvres to windows in the north/rear elevation of unit 3 (as shown indicatively on drawing no. 155-A 2-GA 202D hereby permitted) shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be implemented accordingly prior to the first occupation of this unit. All windows shall be non-opening or hinged to open inwards, and the windows and louvres shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise in accordance with these requirements.
Condition : 12 - The external staircase to the rear of the premises (as shown on drawing no. 155-A 2-GA 301H hereby permitted) shall only be used as a fire escape access.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby permitted, the local planning authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of Blue Badge holders, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, a Travel Plan which shall
include clear objectives and modal split targets, together with a time-bound
programme of implementation, monitoring, regular review and update; and be based
on the particulars contained within the approved development, shall be submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, the Travel Plan
shall be implemented in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 15 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, full details (including
manufacturers specifications) of the cycle parking provision for the development shall
be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The
approved details shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling
Design Standards in design and layout, and be fully implemented and be made
available for use before the first occupation of the building hereby approved and
thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 16 - No external lighting shall be installed on the site or affixed to any buildings unless
the Local Planning Authority has first approved in writing details of the position,
height, design, intensity and time restrictions.

Condition : 17 - (a). The disabled access lifts as shown on the approved floor plans shall be fully
implemented and made available for use before the first use or occupation of the
development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
(b). All doorways to be fitted shall have a minimum clear width of 900mm.

Condition : 18 - Prior to the first use of the commercial premises, a Delivery and Servicing Plan
shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The
development shall only be implemented in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 20 - Prior to the first use of the commercial premises, the refuse and recycling store
as shown on the approved plans shall be fully constructed and thereafter retained for
use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 21 - Prior to the first occupation of the residential units, details of the arrangements for
the storing of waste and recycled materials shall be submitted to and approved by the
Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, these arrangements shall be implemented in
accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 22 - Prior to commencement of works (excluding site investigations), final detailed
drainage designs (including drawings) shall be submitted to the Local Planning
Authority which demonstrate the surface water drainage and flood risk management
proposals for the site, including the minimisation of runoff rates to no more than 46 l/s
from the site in storm events of up to and including the 1 in 100 year plus climate
change return period, through the use of green roofs as per the concepts approved in
the October 2016 Flood Risk Assessment and rainwater harvesting where possible.
The existing site?s surface water drainage system must be assessed through a CCTV
drainage survey to confirm that the existing pipe network is suitable to continue to
use. An associated detailed maintenance plan for each drainage feature component
proposed must also be submitted and shall include all routine maintenance tasks
(including frequencies) and confirmation of the body/bodies responsible for
undertaking the maintenance.

Condition : 23 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, evidence that the drainage
system has been built as per the final detailed drainage designs must be submitted to
and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include the
submission of photographs, copies of installation contracts and written confirmation that the drainage features will be managed as per the detailed maintenance plan for
the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 24 - Prior to the first use of the commercial premises, a report and details/
specifications shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority detailing how the
provisions and conclusions of the Noise Impact Assessment dated 4th November
2016 have been met. This shall confirm: (i). that the cumulative level of noise from
machinery and plant serving the commercial premises shall not exceed a rating level
10 dB lower than the background noise level at any residential building; and (ii).
sound attenuation measures and use of vibration isolation mounts to minimise
transmission of structure borne sound. The details submitted pursuant to this
condition shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and be fully
implemented before the commercial use is commenced.

Condition : 25 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, full particulars and details
of a scheme to insulate the premises against the transmission of airborne and impact
sound has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the
development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved
details.

Condition : 26 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development, a scheme for the control of
fumes and odours shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning
Authority in writing and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in
accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 27 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs,
installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment
Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning
Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed
in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved
revisions.

Condition : 28 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development, evidence (schedule of fittings
and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and
approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in
accordance with the approved internal water use calculations.

Condition : 29 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs
and copies of installation contracts) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority
and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in
accordance with the approved sustainable materials standards:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls,
windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) have
achieved a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The
Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products have been sourced from
accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of
Forestry Certification (PEFC) schemes.
- No construction or insulation materials have been used which will release
toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete
stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 30 - Within three months of work starting on site (excluding site investigations), a
BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent
standard that replaces this) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local
Planning Authority to show that a ?Very Good? (minimum score 68.2%) rating will be
achieved. Prior to first use or occupation of the development, a BREEAM Post-
Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent
standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the
Local Planning Authority to show that a ?Very Good? (minimum score 68.2%) rating
has been achieved.
